intro: Loncomelos ponticum, commonly known as the Caucasian mountain grape, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Vitaceae family, which includes vines and climbers, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by clusters of berries. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in temperate climates and is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils.
